dataset.title: Preparation of Composite Board Using Foil- and Plastic- Laminated Liquid Packaging Paperboard as Raw Materials

abstract.para: We investigated the properties of composite board formed using base sheets of aluminum foil- and polyethylene (PE) plastic-laminated liquid packaging paperboard (LP) as an alternative to recycling these items in wastepaper stream. Boards of different specific gravities ranging from 0.55 to 0.75 were made by pressing shredded LP blended with urea resin having resin content of 6% to 10% at 180℃. Subsequently, we also prepared mixed particleboard (wood (WD) particles and LP mixed), 3-layered particleboard (with LP as the middle layer; WD in the upper and lower layers), and wood particleboard all having resin content of 10% and various specific gravities. Static bending and internal bonding strengths and thickness swelling of the specimens were carried out to examine their properties. At the same specific gravity, the properties of LP particle- boards were affected by their resin content. The modulus of rupture (MOR), modulus of elasticity (MOE) and internal bond of the LP particleboards increased with increasing specific gravities of the boards at the same resin content, but thickness swelling of the LP particleboards showed a reversed trend. The average MOR of the LP particleboards approximated that of the mixed particleboards and was greater than those of the 3-layered particleboards and wood particleboards. Internal bond and thickness swelling of the LP particleboards were smaller than those of the other particleboards. Based on the above observations, we deemed that LP can be made into composite boards of adequate properties either alone or mixed with wood particles.

intellectualRights.para: There are no restriction for this document.

section.title: static bending
section.para: In accordance with JIS A5908:2003 test methods. Specimens for the static bending test had dimensions of 5 cm width and 20 cm length, load was applied at the center of the 15 cm span (15 x of the board thickness). Loading rate during the static bending was 10 mm/min. In the internal bond test, specimens of 5 cm x 5 cm were glued to steel anvil and tensile loads parallel to the specimen surfaces was applied at a 2 mm/min rate, the maximum tensile loading at the point of delamination was determined for each test specimen.

section.title: internal bond
section.para: In the internal bond test, specimens of 5 cm x 5 cm were glued to steel anvil and tensile loads parallel to the specimen surfaces was applied at a 2 mm/min rate, the maximum tensile loading at the point of delamination was determined for each test specimen.

section.title: water absorption swelling
section.para: In the water absorption swelling test, specimens of 5 cm x 5 cm were placed horizontally in a bath of 25±1℃ water, with the top specimen surface held 3 cm below the surface of water for a period of 24 h. A micro- meter caliper was used to determine the thickness changes before and after water immersion and to calculate the thickness swelling.

codeDefinition.definition: LP:aluminum and plastic laminated liquid packaging board;PB:particleboards
aluminum and plastic laminated liquid packaging board
